cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of matching appearance subspaces in computer vision, which is a common topic in the computer vision community. The paper specifically addresses the problem of matching subspaces across different scales, which is a sub-problem within computer vision. The paper proposes a novel approach to solve this problem, which involves interpolation and rotation of the subspaces. This approach is likely to be of interest to researchers working in computer vision, machine learning, and image processing. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper involves mathematical optimization and signal processing techniques, which are relevant to the sub-categories cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.IT (Information Theory).
